title: Jadir Morgenstern
text:
Jadir Morgenstern (born 29 May 1974), or simply Jadir (), is a <a href="Association%20football">football</a> manager and former player who is the manager of Brazilian club <a href="Toledo%20Esporte%20Clube">Toledo U19</a>.
Born in Brazil, Jadir is of <a href="Lebanese%20Brazilians">Lebanese descent</a>; he represented <a href="Lebanon%20national%20football%20team">Lebanon</a> internationally at the <a href="2000%20AFC%20Asian%20Cup">2000 AFC Asian Cup</a> as a <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29%23Centre-back">centre-back</a>.
Club career.
Jadir started his professional career at <a href="Toledo%20Col%C3%B4nia%20Work">Toledo</a>, being sold to <a href="Clube%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Paranaense">Atlético Paranaense</a> for the <a href="1993%20Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20A">1993 Campeonato Brasileiro Série A</a> in which his team was relegated. After spending another year at Furacão, he spent the next years being loaned to lower clubs. In 1996, he won the <a href="Campeonato%20Mato-Grossense">Campeonato Mato-Grossense</a> with <a href="Mixto%20Esporte%20Clube">Mixto</a>, playing in the final. In 1998, playing for <a href="Tubar%C3%A3o%20Futebol%20Clube">Tubarão</a>, he won the <a href="Copa%20Santa%20Catarina">Copa Santa Catarina</a>.
In 2000, he moved to Lebanese club <a href="Al-Ansar%20Club">Al-Ansar</a>, later being naturalized and making his debut for <a href="Lebanon%20national%20football%20team">Lebanon</a> later in the year. He spent the rest of his career at the Asian country, except for a brief spell at <a href="Sociedade%20Esportiva%20e%20Recreativa%20Juventude">Juventude-MT</a>, playing also for <a href="Hekmeh%20FC">Hekmeh FC</a> and <a href="Al-Akhaa%20Al-Ahli%20Aley">Akhaa Ahli Aley</a> before ending his career at Al-Ansar.
International career.
Jadir represented <a href="Lebanon%20national%20football%20team">Lebanon</a> at the <a href="2000%20AFC%20Asian%20Cup">2000 AFC Asian Cup</a> and the <a href="2002%20FIFA%20World%20Cup%20qualification%20%28AFC%29%23Group%205">World Cup 2002 Qualifying</a>.
Managerial career.
Jadir coaches the <a href="Toledo%20Esporte%20Clube">Toledo</a> under-19 team, a position he holds since 2014.
Personal life.
Jadir's brother, <a href="Jorge%20Morgenstern%20%28footballer%29">Jorge</a>, was also a professional footballer having played most for <a href="Paran%C3%A1%20%28state%29">Paraná</a>-based clubs. Jadir has a son, Adriel, who also plays football.
